data.title: Tourist Information
data.meta_description: Tourist Information - Malt Whisky - Moray Council
data.text:
Tourist Information - Malt Whisky

Moray is the ancestral home of the distilling industry and the unique Malt Whisky Trail links several of the area’s leading distilleries where visitors can get an insight into the production of Scotland’s national drink, from grain to glass. Every year tens of thousands of visitors follow the trail and take advantage of the opportunity to tour the distilleries. Booking ahead is always recommended.

Use the links below to find out more:

Aberlour Distillery

http://www.aberlour.com/

Balvenie Distillery, Dufftown

See the barley malting process for malt whisky

http://www.thebalvenie.com/

Benromach, Distillery, Forres

www.benromach.com

Cardhu Distillery, Knockando

On the Malt Whisky Trail

https://www.visitscotland.com/info/see-do/cardhu-distillery-visitors-centre-p418461

Cragganmore Distillery

https://www.visitscotland.com/info/see-do/cragganmore-distillery-visitor-centre-p418501

Dallas Dhu Distillery, Forres

Maintained by Historic Scotland

Dufftown Whisky Museum

Interesting collection of whisky and barrel making memorabilia

Glen Grant Distillery, Rothes

On the Malt Whisky Trail with its own Victorian Gardens

https://www.glengrant.com/

Glen Moray Distillery, Elgin

On the Malt Whisky Trail

https://www.glenmoray.com/

Glenfarclas Distillery, Ballindaloch

On the Malt Whisky Trail

http://www.glenfarclas.com/

Glenfiddich Distillery, Dufftown

On the Malt Whisky Trail

http://www.glenfiddich.com/uk/

Glenlivet Distillery, Glenlivet

On the Malt Whisky Trail

http://uk.theglenlivet.com/

Visitor Centre

http://www.themacallan.com

Malt Whisky Trail

www.maltwhiskytrail.com

A unique visitor centre experience

http://www.speysidecooperage.co.uk/

On the Malt Whisky Trail
